snippet: Even as he accumulated commanding victories in seven states on Tuesday, Mr. Trump confronted a loud and persistent refusal to rally around him.
abstract: News Analysis; primaries in 12 states reveal increasing Democratic unification behind front-runner Hillary Clinton and growing rancor within Republican party as Donald J Trump sweeps contests from Northeast to Deep South; Republican party leaders refuse to throw their support behind Trump and discourage constituents from doing so, pointing to deep schism that some warn will affect party for years to come.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MICHAEL BARBARO
byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters, Matt Flegenheimer, Jennifer Steinhauer and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Even as he accumulated commanding victories in seven states on Tuesday, Mr. Trump confronted a loud and persistent refusal to rally around him.

headline.print_headline: Trump and Clinton Feast as 12 States Vote
headline.main: As Donald Trump Rolls Up Victories, the G.O.P. Split Widens to a Chasm
